title: Today News Headlines for School Assembly, December 4, 2025: Delhi school admissions, US immigration-travel ban and more
content: Today News Headlines for School Assembly, December 04, 2025: Here are the news headlines for school assembly on December 4, 2025. Key national updates include the Centre’s move to amend the Sanchar Saathi mandate, the Calcutta High Court reaffirming cancellation of 32,000 primary teachers’ appointments, and disruptions in IndiGo’s flight operations. International highlights cover parts of the US peace plan being accepted by Russia, a US pause on immigration applications from travel-ban countries and more. The government is preparing to amend its earlier order after backlash over the mandate requiring all phones to be integrated with Sanchar Saathi . Officials said consultations are underway to address concerns raised by citizen groups and manufacturers. The Calcutta High Court has upheld its 2023 order cancelling 32,000 primary teachers’ jobs in West Bengal, stating that the recruitment process was marred by irregularities. The state government is expected to review further legal options. IndiGo’s services faced disruptions after flight operations were affected due to crew shortages and technical issues . The airline said efforts were underway to stabilise schedules and minimise delays. Russian President Vladimir Putin said he has accepted parts of the US peace plan for the Ukraine conflict, but warned that several proposals remain unacceptable to Moscow. The United States has paused immigration applications from nations on its travel-ban list , with authorities saying the action is temporary as updated security assessments are conducted. Malaysia has announced that the search for missing flight MH370 will resume , following new indications shared by exploration companies willing to undertake fresh deep-sea operations. India faces South Africa in the second ODI at Raipur , with both teams looking to gain an advantage in the ongoing series. title: AP TET Admit Card 2025 released at tet2dsc.apcfss.in, exam from Dec 10
content: The Department of School Education, Government of Andhra Pradesh, has released the AP TET 2025 admit cards. Candidates appearing for the Andhra Pradesh Teacher Eligibility Test can now download their hall tickets from the official website, tet2dsc.apcfss.in, using their candidate ID and date of birth. As per the schedule, the AP TET 2025 exam will begin on December 10 in computer-based test (CBT) mode and will be held in two shifts each day. Candidates must carry a printed copy of the admit card along with a valid photo ID to the exam centre. After downloading, candidates should check all details on the admit card carefully. Any errors must be immediately reported to the authorities for correction. Here’s a step by step guide to access your AP TET hall ticket: Step 1: Visit the official website — tet2dsc.apcfss.in Step 2: Log in using your candidate ID, mobile number or Aadhaar number, and date of birth Step 3: Click on “Submit” to view the hall ticket Step 4: Download the admit card and take a clear printout for exam day Once downloaded, candidates appearing for AP TET 2025 can check to verify the exam name, allotted exam-centre, and guidelines that candidates are required to follow on the day of the examination. The AP TET, conducted annually by the Department of School Education, Andhra Pradesh, determines eligibility for teaching posts in primary and upper primary schools across the state. Candidates who qualify Paper I become eligible to teach Classes 1–5, while those clearing Paper II may teach Classes 6–8. Those who clear both papers become eligible for teaching positions from Classes 1–8 in government schools across Andhra Pradesh. title: Over 72,000 foreign students study in India from 200 countries: Centre tells Rajya Sabha
content: As many as 72,218 foreign students from nearly 200 countries are currently enrolled in Indian higher education institutions, the government informed the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. Replying to supplementary questions during Question Hour, Minister of State for Education Sukanta Majumdar said the Union government has sanctioned ₹6,198.99 crore to eight public institutions under the World Class Institutions scheme, introduced to support institutions selected for the Institution of Eminence (IoE) status. Majumdar highlighted a “significant rise in the global visibility of Indian higher education institutions,” noting that 54 institutions have secured a position in the QS World University Rankings (QS WUR) 2026. This marks a substantial jump from 11 institutions in 2014–15, when the current government assumed office. “This is India’s highest-ever representation in the QS rankings,” he said. The minister said India’s foreign student community is diverse, with enrolments spanning a wide range of academic disciplines. “India has around 72,218 foreign students. They are from 200 countries studying different courses,” he noted, adding that the government is taking several steps to enhance collaboration with foreign universities and attract more international students. Providing further details, Majumdar said the World Class Institutions scheme was launched to identify 10 public and 10 private higher education institutions and develop them into globally competitive teaching and research hubs. So far, 12 institutions have been notified as IoEs — eight from the public sector and four from the private sector. An amount of approximately ₹6,198.99 crore has been sanctioned for the eight public IoEs since the scheme’s inception,” he added. title: Delhi Nursery Admissions 2026: Deadlines, detailed criteria, guidelines and how to apply
content: Delhi Nursery Admissions 2026: The Delhi government has notified the full schedule and guidelines for Nursery, KG, and Class 1 admissions for the 2026–27 academic session, with all details released during the latest Delhi Directorate of Education (DoE) circular . The admission cycle will begin on December 4, and schools have also been directed to strictly adhere to the notified timeline, without any deviation. The announcement comes in continuation of the age-restructuring process that began with the introduction of the Foundational Stage under the National Education Policy (NEP). As earlier reported by The Indian Express , Delhi had already moved to realign Nursery, KG, and Class 1 age requirements starting 2025 onwards , bringing all entry-level classes in line with national recommendations. The 2026–27 academic year continues that alignment with no further changes from what was earlier announced. According to the DoE, the following minimum and maximum ages (as on 31 March 2026) will apply across all private unaided recognised schools: –Nursery (Balvatika 1/Pre-School 1): 3+ years up to 4 years –KG (Balvatika 2/Pre-Primary/Pre-School 2): 4+ years up to 5 years –Class 1: 5+ years up to 6 years The DoE has clarified that children admitted to Nursery in 2025–26 will automatically move to KG in 2026–27, and those in KG in 2025–26 will move to Class 1. Admissions to Nursery for 2026–27 will therefore apply strictly to children who have completed three years but not completed four years by March 31, 2026. The circular reiterates that these rules are being enforced exactly as detailed in the DoE’s order dated October 24, 2025, which had first operationalised the NEP-aligned foundational stage structuring. The DoE has released the full timeline for uploading criteria, issuing forms, declarations of lists, grievance windows and closure of the admission cycle. title: Record 672 job offers on day 1 of IIT Kanpur’s placement season 2025–26
content: The placement season at the Indian Institutes of Technology across India has begun, and, according to IIT Kanpur, its students received 672 job offers on December 1, the highest day 1 tally to date. In their ongoing 2025–26 campus placement, IIT-Kanpur has registered a 16% increase over last year’s day-1 placements. With some results still pending, the count is expected to rise further. These include Pre-Placement Offers (PPOs), reflecting a significant 20% rise in placements compared to the previous season. As per a statement by IITs, PPOs played a major role with 253 offers recorded, marking a strong 27% increase over the last year. Moreover, nine students secured overseas offers. Read | IIT Bombay was mentored by Soviet Union, alumnus gave Rupee symbol – institute’s legacy, repute and history Over 250 companies have shown interest in hiring IITK students this year, including Accenture, BlackRock, HSBC, SAP, Airbus, PwC, Navi, Qualcomm, and Deutsche Bank, among others. As per an RTI filed by The Indian Express , 19 of the 23 IITs show that three-fourths of them have seen an increase in the percentage of students placed in 2024-25 compared to the previous year, when there had been a sharp slump in placements across most IITs. This included IIT Kanpur. Despite the increase in the placement, numbers for 2024-25 are still below the 2021-22 level across all 19 IITs. Meanwhile, in case a student aspires to study in this premier institute, they can apply for scholarship. One of which is students securing an All India Rank (AIR) under 100 in JEE Advanced are eligible for the Bright Minds Scholarship. Each recipient is given Rs 3 lakh annually, covering the full cost of undergraduate education at IIT Kanpur, ensuring that top-performing students can pursue their studies without financial constraints. title: IIT Bombay was mentored by Soviet Union, alumnus gave Rupee symbol – institute’s legacy amid name change row
content: When IIT Bombay opened its doors in March of 1958, funded not in dollars or pounds but in Soviet Roubles, few could have imagined that the institute would one day be the birthplace from where the symbol of the Indian rupee ‘₹’ (Ra) would come, from its PhD scholar D Udaya Kumar. The Maharashtra government recently renewing its efforts to officially rename IIT Bombay as IIT ‘ Mumbai ’, has renewed the debate beyond a mere change of signage. It reaches into history, of the institute, of the city, and of how names become repositories of identity and legacy. According to the institute’s own archival notes, IIT Bombay was set up in 1958 as the second IIT in India, after IIT Kharagpur in Bengal, and the first to receive foreign assistance, with UNESCO arranging funds provided by the Soviet Union. With the newly independent nation investing in scientific capacity-building, the first cohort of just 100 students began classes in Worli, even as the Powai campus was still under construction. The 1961 Institutes of Technology Act declared all IITs as Institutes of National Importance. Over the decades, IIT Bombay expanded steadily with new departments, advanced research centres, interdisciplinary labs, incubators, and a postgraduate ecosystem that would produce thousands of researchers. But the rise of IIT Bombay was also inseparable from the city that housed it, a city whose own history of names reflects centuries of shifting rule, culture, and political imagination. Long before its colonial-era name, the region now called Mumbai finds mention as early as 250 BCE in Greek sources. As per government historical accounts stated in Mumbai City’s official government history page, available at mumbaicity.gov.in , the island cluster formed part of Emperor Ashoka’s Mauryan empire and later came under the Shilahara dynasty till 1343 CE. The city’s indigenous identity draws from Mumba Devi, the patron deity of the Koli fishing community. “Mumbai” combines ‘Mumba’ (the Mother goddess) an

title: 118 medical colleges opened in India in past two years: Which state got the most?
content: The union government has set up 118 medical colleges in the country in the last two years. The Union health ministry informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday, during the ongoing Winter session of Parliament. Responding to a question by MP Anupriya Patel, the ministry shared the details in a written reply, stating that 74 medical colleges were approved in AY 2024–25 and 44 in AY 2025–26, based on National Medical Commission (NMC) approvals. The reply also included the state-wise distribution of these colleges. Uttar Pradesh saw the highest number of new colleges across the two years, followed by Maharashtra and Rajasthan. The reply further stated that the expansion of medical infrastructure is part of the government’s ongoing effort to increase the availability of medical education and healthcare services. (Source: Rajya Sabha UNSTARRED QUESTION NO. 268, Answered on December 2, 2025) In a separate written reply, Union Health Minister J P Nadda informed the House that India’s doctor-population ratio is currently estimated at 1:811, assuming that 80 per cent of registered practitioners in both allopathic and AYUSH systems are available. India has 13,88,185 registered allopathic doctors and 7,51,768 AYUSH practitioners. Nadda added that the number of medical colleges has risen from 387 to 818 since 2014, while UG seats have increased from 51,348 to 1,28,875 and PG seats from 31,185 to 82,059. The government also detailed the seat additions over the last two years. According to the response, 8,641 undergraduate seats were added in AY 2024–25 and 11,732 UG seats in AY 2025–26. Postgraduate capacity saw the addition of 4,188 PG seats in AY 2024–25 and 3,393 PG seats in AY 2025–26. Looking ahead, the government outlined its future expansion plan. On September 24, the Union Cabinet approved Phase-III of the Centrally Sponsored Scheme for strengthening and upgrading state and central government medical colleges and standalone PG institutes. title: ‘Air still smells toxic:’ Routine returns to Delhi schools as classes go offline amid poor AQI
content: Offline classes for students up to Class 5 resumed this week across Delhi-NCR after the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) lifted Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) Stage-3 restrictions. The move came after a marginal improvement in Delhi’s air quality, though the AQI has continued to oscillate between the “poor” and “very poor” categories. Parents and students said the reopening has brought back routine but not relief. Many expressed unease about children commuting and sitting in classrooms amid what they describe as “visible pollution”. “The AQI may have improved on paper, but the air still smells toxic. My son starts coughing the moment he steps out. I’m not fully convinced schools should have reopened so quickly,” said Mamta Agrawal, a parent from Noida. Others felt academic continuity needed priority. “Children can’t keep shifting between online and offline modes. My daughter’s focus breaks every time this happens,” said Yogendra Yadav, a parent from East Delhi . Read | CBSE Board Exams 2025: Practical exams marks to be uploaded on same-day; check detailed SOPs here Teachers voiced concerns about classroom ventilation and preparedness. “Not all schools have air purifiers, and younger students often either forget masks or are not comfortable using them. We worry about prolonged exposure,” said Sumit Parashar, a government school teacher in North Delhi. “It’s definitely challenging for us as teachers. Online classes demand that we constantly work to keep students focused on a screen, and that itself is tiring. Now that offline classes are resuming, we have to divide our attention between students sitting in front of us and those who may still be joining remotely. Managing both formats together affects the pace of teaching, and it becomes difficult to ensure every child is engaged and learning equally,” said the Delhi government school teacher. title: SBI SO Registrations 2025 start at sbi.bank.in; 996 posts in offer
content: SBI SO Recruitment 2025 Registration: The State Bank of India ( SBI ) has issued the SBI Specialist Officer (SO) Recruitment 2025 notification. Applications are currently underway, and candidates can apply until December 23. In order to apply, eligible candidates are required to register on the recruitment portal of SBI at sbi.bank.in/careers . The Specialist Officer roles under the SBI SO 2025 recruitment will be filled on a five-year contractual appointment. After the completion of this period, the bank may extend the contract for up to four additional years, depending on performance and any renewal conditions laid down by SBI. The available positions are of VP Wealth, AVP Wealth, and Customer Relations Executive, with a total of 996 posts across these. Step 1: Visit the SBI recruitment portal at sbi.bank.in Step 2: Find and read the SBI SO Recruitment 2025 notification to understand eligibility and vacancy distribution Step 3: Register on the portal by entering personal details to generate login credentials Step 4: Complete the application form by providing educational and professional information Step 5: Upload the required documents, pay the applicable fee, and submit the form before December 23, 2025 The recruitment process for SBI Specialist Officers in 2025 consists of two stages. First, applicants will be shortlisted based on the information they provide, including their academic background, relevant work experience and overall suitability for the post. Candidates who clear this stage will be invited for a personal interview, during which their professional competence, subject knowledge and role fit will be evaluated. title: AIIMS INI SS 2025 Results Out: How to check at aiimsexams.ac.in
content: AIIMS INI SS 2025 Results Out: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has announced the results of the Institute of National Importance Super-Speciality (INI-SS) Entrance Test for the January 2026 session. Candidates who sat for the exam on November 22, 2025, can view the roll number–wise list of provisionally qualified candidates on the official AIIMS examination portal–aiimsexams.ac.in. As per the notification, the results include candidates who have cleared Stage I of the INI-SS examination. These candidates are eligible to seek admission to DM/MCh programmes at AIIMS New Delhi , established AIIMS campuses, Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (JIPMER) Puducherry , Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER) Chandigarh , National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS) Bengaluru , and Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology (SCTIMST) Trivandrum. AIIMS has issued the results in PDF format, which candidates can download directly without requiring login credentials. The document provides details, including each candidate’s roll number, the category under which they applied, and their qualification status. Candidates are advised to carefully verify this information to confirm their eligibility for the next stage of admission. Following the announcement of the results, AIIMS Delhi will oversee the counselling process for qualified candidates. Those eligible must first register for counselling and then submit their preferences for the available super-speciality seats. Final seat allotment will be determined based on the merit list and the choices entered by candidates. For the January 2026 academic session, AIIMS will hold three rounds of counselling to allocate super-speciality seats across leading institutions, including AIIMS, PGIMER, NIMHANS, and SCTIMST. title: APTET 2025 Hall Tickets out on candidate portal, here’s how to check
content: The Department of School Education, Government of Andhra Pradesh, has issued the AP TET 2025 hall ticket, December 3. Candidates can download their APTET admit card from the official website at tet2dsc.apcfss.in, by entering their candidate ID and date of birth. Latest Update| AP DSE issues APTET 2025 Hall Tickets at tet2dsc.apcfss.in According to the schedule, the AP TET examination will begin on December 10, 2025, in computer-based test (CBT) mode, conducted in two shifts daily. All candidates must carry a printed copy of their hall ticket along with a valid photo ID proof to the exam centre. After downloading, candidates should carefully verify the details mentioned on the hall ticket. Any discrepancies or errors must be promptly reported to the exam conducting authority for correction. Candidates can follow these steps to download their AP TET hall tickets 2025 online. Step 1: Visit the official website – tet2dsc.apcfss.in. Step 2: Log in using credentials like ID, mobile Number or Aadhar number along with date of birth in the space provided. Step 3: Click on the submit to proceed. Step 4: Download and take a printout of the AP TET 2025 hall ticket for future use. The AP TET 2025 admit card contains all the essential information related to the examination, including details of the exam centre, schedule, and candidate particulars. It mentions the exam name, the candidate’s name, the father’s and mother’s names, registration number, and roll number. In addition, it specifies the category, gender, and date of birth of the applicant, along with the date of the AP TET 2025 exam, exam time and shift, and the name and address of the allotted exam centre. The hall ticket also provides important exam day instructions that candidates must follow to ensure the smooth conduct of the test. title: IIM-Raipur announces new Business Accelerator programme with 100% fee sponsorship, applications underway
content: Indian Institute of Management Raipur (IIM Raipur) has partnered with the National SC-ST Hub (NSSH) of the Ministry of MSME, Government of India, to launch a comprehensive Business Accelerator programme. Applications for the Business Accelerator programme are open until December 15, 2025, with the programme set to begin on January 17, 2026. Also Read | CAT exam application fees rise 31% since 2021 The initiative aims to empower existing and aspiring SC/ST entrepreneurs, start-ups, and small business owners by equipping them with the skills, knowledge, and support essential for scaling their ventures. The new programme is designed to help participants move beyond survival and achieve sustainable, scalable growth. The programme follows a blended learning model that combines immersive on-campus sessions at IIM Raipur with engaging live online classes. It also offers 72 hours of structured instruction and 18 hours of dedicated mentoring by IIM Raipur faculty, industry leaders, and seasoned practitioners, ensuring a transformative and growth-driven learning experience for every participant. The accelerator programme is built to help participants sharpen their business models, identify high-potential markets, strengthen financial decision-making, and leverage digital tools for operational efficiency. Through concept sessions, case discussions rooted in MSME realities, hands-on exercises, and one-on-one mentoring clinics, entrepreneurs will work directly on their business challenges and develop clear 90–180 day action roadmaps. This programme, an IIM Raipur statement says, also provides participants with opportunities to explore new markets, understand government procurement processes, and build valuable networks with peers, mentors, and ecosystem partners who can support their entrepreneurial journey. title: Karnataka HC restricts fresh recruitment under state’s enhanced SC/ST quota law
content: In a setback to the state government, the Karnataka High Court has barred it from issuing any fresh recruitment notifications in an Act which had raised quotas for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes. The restriction on recruitment under the Karnataka Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Scheduled Tribes (STs) (Reservation of Seats in Education Institutions and Appointments of Posts and Services under the State) Act, 2022, will remain until further orders. However, the HC bench allowed the government to continue recruitment processes already notified before November 19, 2025, even if they follow the increased reservation percentages. The court also clarified that all appointments made through these ongoing recruitments will be subject to the final outcome of the petitions challenging the law. The division bench of Chief Justice Vibhu Bakhru and Justice C M Poonacha issued the interim order on November 27 while hearing two PILs filed by Mahendra Kumar Mitra of Raichur and Mahesh of Bengaluru . The petitions question the constitutional validity of the 2022 Act, particularly the hike in SC/ST reservation, from 15 per cent to 17 per cent for SCs and from 3 per cent to 7 per cent for STs. Other Backward Classes (OBCs) reservation continues to remain at 32 per cent, which takes over all reservations in the state to 56 per cent. The Bench directed that all appointment or promotion orders issued under the Act must explicitly state that they are provisional and contingent on the court’s final judgment, preventing candidates from claiming equity if the enhanced quotas are struck down. The court further stated that this interim permission to continue ongoing recruitments will not override any specific interim or final orders already passed by courts or tribunals in related matters. The government had earlier argued that halting ongoing recruitments would disrupt administrative functioning due to manpower shortages. The petitions also contend that the increased reservation breaches the

title: Jammu and Kashmir designates JKBOSE as standards authority for the UT
content: The Jammu and Kashmir government on Monday designated the Board of School Education as the State School Standards Authority for the Union territory, in accordance with the provisions of the National Education Policy 2020. An order issued by the Under Secretary in the School Education Department, Thanaji Bhat, said the decision is aimed at ensuring transparent, independent and effective regulation of schools across Jammu and Kashmir. “In exercise of the powers vested in the School Education Department, the J-K Board of School Education ( JKBOSE ) is hereby designated as the State School Standards Authority (SSSA) for the Union territory, in accordance with the provisions and mandates of the National Education Policy ( NEP ) 2020,” the order said. As mandated under NEP-2020 , the SSSA will oversee separation of regulatory, academic, examination and administrative functions, and will be entrusted with responsibilities related to standard setting, monitoring and ensuring compliance with norms concerning safety, infrastructure, teacher qualifications, governance and financial probity. The order also takes note of the recommendation of PARAKH – the national assessment centre under NCERT – which suggests that state examination boards be designated as SSSAs to ensure equivalence of standards across different school boards. Several boards, including the CBSE at the national level, and the boards of Himachal Pradesh and Mizoram, have already been notified as SSSAs by the respective governments. JKBOSE , established under the Jammu and Kashmir Board of School Education Act, 1975, is the statutory body responsible for curriculum development, examinations and affiliation of schools in the UT, and possesses the required infrastructure, systems and expertise to discharge the regulatory functions of the authority. title: JEE Main, NEET: Govt school students in Delhi to get free coaching for engineering, medical, law and other exams
content: The Delhi Government will be offering free professional coaching to 2,200 meritorious government school students for JEE , NEET , CLAT , CA and CUET under the Mahamana Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya Vidya Shakti Mission, Education Minister Ashish Sood has announced. The mission aims to empower students’ aspirations, ensure emotional well-being and build future-ready schools across the capital, an official statement said on Monday. This scheme, which was announced in the budget , has an allocation of Rs 21 crore. It reserves 50 seats per course for female students in JEE, NEET, CLAT, and CA Foundation, while CUET-UG will offer 1,000 seats, with 150 reserved for girls. Coaching will be provided through empanelled institutions, including Aakash Institute, Narayana Academy, KD Campus and Ravindra Institute, it said. Students will receive classroom coaching, live sessions, study material and test preparation support after school hours and on weekends. Calling it a turning point in Delhi ’s public education, Sood said 62,000 students appeared for the CET-2025 conducted on October 30. Counselling has concluded, and physical classes commenced on November 26, 2025. Reiterating the importance of emotionally safe learning environments, the minister said, education is not just about marks; it is about mental wellness, dignity and humanity. He further emphasised that the government is developing AI-enabled classrooms and human-centred education systems to ensure truly equal opportunities for every child. Highlighting the mission’s meritocratic spirit, Sood said the Vidya Shakti Mission is a movement to empower talent, protect mental wellness and unlock Delhi’s academic potential at the grassroots. title: IIT Scholarships: Want to study at IIT Roorkee? Know about these scholarships
content: The Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee (IIT Roorkee) awards scholarships annually to deserving students. These are offered either as tuition fee concessions or direct transfers to students’ bank accounts. Key scholarships include Merit-cum-Means, James Thomason, INSPIRE SHE, Dr S.K. Goel, and Kusum Goel for disadvantaged engineering students, as well as the Sharman Foundation. IIT Roorkee offers undergraduate programs across 10 disciplines in engineering and architecture, along with postgraduate programmes in 55 fields spanning engineering, applied sciences, architecture, and planning. Also Read | IIT Kharagpur Scholarships | IIT-Hyderabad Scholarships The Merit Cum Means (MCM) scholarship at IIT Roorkee provides financial support to undergraduate and M.Sc. students. Eligible UG students receive at least Rs 1,000 per month for 10 months along with a refund of the remaining tuition fee, while M.Sc. students receive Rs 1,000 per month for 10 months. The scholarship is available only for the normal duration of the programme, and for dual degree courses, it is limited to the first four years. Also Read | IIT Mandi Scholarships It is awarded to up to 25 per cent of the actual strength of each class. To qualify, applicants must belong to the General, General (EWS), or OBC category, be enrolled in BTech, BArch, IDD, IMT, IMS, BS-MS (via JEE Advanced), or MSc (via JAM) programs, and have a parental or guardian income not exceeding Rs 5 lakh in the current assessment year. Students must maintain a CGPA and YGPA of 7.00 or above, clear all registered courses, and have no record of indiscipline or use of unfair means. Fresh entrants are exempt from the CGPA and course clearance requirements. Also Read | IIT Bombay Scholarships The James Thomason (JT) Scholarship at IIT Roorkee is awarded to students admitted through JEE (Advanced) into BTech., B.Arch., Integrated Dual Degree (IDD), Integrated Master of Technology (IMT), Integrated Master of Science (IMS), and BS-MS program

title: UPPSC PCS 2025 prelims result out, link to download here
content: UPPSC PCS Prelims Result 2025: The Uttar Pradesh Public Service Commission (UPPSC) has released the UPPSC PCS 2025 prelims result. The Commission has made the UPPSC PCS 2025 prelims result link available at uppsc.up.nic.in. As many as 11,727 candidates will now appear in the next stage of recruitment. The Commission had earlier released the answer keys on October 18 and candidates were able to raise objections against the answer key. Based on the objections received on the UPPSC PCS provisional answer key, the Commission prepared the final answer key and announced the UPPSC prelims result 2025. Step 1: Visit the official website of UPPSC — uppsc.up.nic.in. Step 2: Click on the designated UPPSC PCS answer key 2025 link available on the home page Step 3: Check and download the result The UPPSC PCS prelims exam was held on October 12. The examination is divided into three parts — the preliminary exam, the mains exam, and the interview. According to reports, out of over 6.26 lakh registered candidates, of which 2.65 lakh appeared for the exam. In Prayagraj, out of 28,368 registered candidates at 67 centres, only 14,339 (50.54%) appeared, while 14,029 (49.46%) were absent. Candidates who qualify the Mains exam will be shortlisted for the Interview round. The UPPSC will announce further updates, including the Mains exam dates and admit card release schedule, on its official website in due course. title: ‘We’ll engage with the US govt, but stay true to our mission’: University of Arizona president on rejecting Trump’s higher-ed compact
content: Seven out of nine universities that the White House initially offered a “compact” granting preferential federal funding in exchange for aligning with President Donald Trump’s policy priorities have now declined to sign it. The University of Arizona became the latest institution to reject the proposal, joining Brown University, Dartmouth College, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) , the University of Pennsylvania, the University of Southern California, and the University of Virginia. The remaining two institutions, Vanderbilt University and the University of Texas at Austin, have not yet publicly declined. The Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education, sent to the nine universities on October 1, outlines 10 reform areas that institutions would need to comply with to access priority federal funding. The proposed measures include banning the consideration of race and sex in admissions, capping the proportion of international students, abolishing student groups that “punish or belittle conservative ideas,” and defining gender based strictly on “reproductive function and biological processes.” Suresh Garimella, the President of the University of Arizona, spoke to The Indian Express over email about the university’s decision, the meaning of academic freedom in 2025, and the landscape for international students, particularly from India. Q: What does ‘academic freedom’ mean to you in the present political climate? At the University of Arizona, we regard academic freedom as foundational to our mission. It protects the right to pursue knowledge and engage in civil debate, even on difficult subjects, while ensuring that learning and respectful dialogue can flourish. We do not allow intimidation, disruption, or vandalism that undermines speech or participation in campus life. Consistent with our Statement of Principles, the university does not take positions on political or social issues beyond those affecting our teaching, research, or operations. We als

title: IIT Roorkee Placements 2025: 436 students secure offers on day one; 8 international, 428 in domestic
content: IIT Roorkee has started its placement process for the 2025–26 academic year. According to an official statement, students and recruiters participated actively from the opening slot, marking the beginning of the institute’s annual recruitment cycle. The institute has collaborated with organisations across sectors, with roles concentrated in artificial intelligence, data analytics, semiconductor technology, sustainability and core engineering domains. The partnerships, according to the official statement, have been structured to reflect current industry requirements and student specialisations. At the close of the 1.1 slot on Day 1, IIT Roorkee recorded 8 international offers and 428 domestic offers. More offers are expected as the remaining Day 1 sessions progress. The institute noted that the early numbers indicate an improvement over the same period last year. Recruiters on campus Companies participating in this phase include Amazon, American Express, Bajaj Auto , BEL, BPCL, D. E. Shaw, Databricks, Flipkart, Google, HPCL, Mastercard, Meesho, Microsoft, NatWest Group, NVIDIA, Oracle, Qualcomm, SAP Labs, SLB Engineering & Software, Sprinklr, Squarepoint Capital, Texas Instruments and others. The institute expects the momentum to continue through subsequent slots, with more organisations scheduled to conduct processes over the next several days.  The depression (remnant of Cyclonic Storm Ditwah) over southwest Bay of Bengal and adjoining North Tamil Nadu and Puducherry coasts has moved south-southwestwards. However, the spate of rain in Chennai and other districts in Tamil Nadu is not over. So far four deaths have been reported due to rain-related incidents in the state.

title: Here’s why record 37 lakh applicants have appeared in China’s civil service exam
content: China’s civil service exam saw a record 3.7 million candidates, showing how competition for government jobs is rising as the country faces high unemployment and an uncertain job market. The exam, which selects candidates for central government roles and their branches, saw roughly 98 applicants competing for every available post, according to official data. Authorities also disclosed that approximately 70 per cent of the vacancies are earmarked for fresh college graduates, according to a report of the China Internet Information Center. The sweeping changes this year stem from a major policy shift: the general age cap for aspirants has been raised from 35 to 38 years, while fresh graduates holding master’s or doctoral degrees can now sit for the exam up to age 43, a considerable increase from prior limits (which were 35 and 40, respectively). Beijing has framed the reforms as part of efforts to adjust to shifting demographic realities, including a shrinking working-age population and an increasing trend of prolonged education and delayed workforce entry. Analysts suggest the revised age limits also help counter pervasive “ageism” in the job market and harness the skills of slightly older or more experienced candidates for public service. Read | ‘We’ll engage with the government, but stay true to our mission’: University of Arizona president on rejecting Trump’s higher-ed compact But the surge in applicants and stiff competition also reflects broader socioeconomic pressures. Many in China, according to a Guardian report , appear to be turning away from unstable private-sector jobs in favour of government roles that still promise the much-coveted “iron-rice-bowl” of lifetime job security, even if pay is lower and growth slower. For context, the 2026 recruitment drive aims to fill about 38,100 civil-service posts across central government institutions and their subordinate agencies. In India, the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) conducts the Civil Services Examina

title: CAT exam application fees rise 31% since 2021: Asaduddin Owaisi
content: The application fees for the Common Admission Test (CAT) have risen by 31 per cent since 2021. On the opening day of the Winter Session of Parliament, Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi raised a question to the Ministry of Education regarding the steep hike in CAT application fees. Conducted by the Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) , the exam serves as a gateway for students aspiring to pursue MBA programmes. CAT 2025 Exam Paper Analysis Owaisi informed the Lok Sabha that, as compared to CAT 2024 , there has been an approximate increase of 5 per cent in the application fee of CAT 2025 . This year’s exam was conducted on November 30, in three slots and was hosted by IIM Kozhikode . For CAT 2025, the application fee is Rs 2,600 for General and OBC candidates, and Rs 1,300 for SC, ST, and PwBD applicants. In comparison, the fee in 2021 was Rs 2,200 for General/OBC and Rs 1,100 for SC, ST, and PwBD categories. CAT 2025 Live Updates The Minister of State in the Ministry of Education, Dr Sukanta Majumdar, replied to Owaisi’s question that the Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) are governed under the Indian Institutes of Management Act, 2017, and are empowered to determine, specify, and receive payments of fees and other charges. Also Read | India sees 26% surge in MBA applications as UK, Canada programmes report declines amid visa uncertainty “The Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) are governed under the Indian Institutes of Management Act, 2017, as amended from time to time. Under the Act, the IIMs are empowered to determine, specify and receive payments of fees and other charges,” said MoS Dr Sukanta Majumdar. The Minister elaborated on how the application fees are used by the conducting IIM to successfully conduct the CAT exam. “The CAT application fee is decided every year to cover the administrative, logistical, and operational costs involved in conducting the exam in that year on a national scale,” he said, adding that the CAT fee is non-refundable as the lo

title: NITK-Surathkal holds ring presentation ceremony for 2020, 2021 batches; over 1700 students take part
content: The National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NIT-K), Surathkal conducted its Ring Presentation Ceremony on 29 November 2025 at the institute campus. The event honoured graduates from the 2020 and 2021 batches, who had completed their programmes during the COVID-19 pandemic. A total of 1,731 students received their silver rings, either in person or through home delivery, according to an official statement. After sharp slump in 2023-24, IIT placements improve, still below 2021-22 mark The ceremony marked the formal recognition of 881 students from the 2020 batch and 850 from the 2021 batch. The 2020 cohort included 555 B.Tech, 247 M.Tech, 10 MBA, 10 MCA, 23 M.Sc. and 36 Ph.D. graduates, while the 2021 cohort comprised 475 B.Tech, 253 M.Tech, 17 MBA, 57 MCA, 12 M.Sc. and 36 Ph.D. graduates. Each student was presented with a silver ring engraved with the NI-K emblem and their year of graduation. The tradition, initiated over fifty years ago by Prof AS Adke, continues to be a distinctive feature of NIT -K and is viewed as a symbol of lasting connection between the institute and its alumni. At IIT Indore, these courses continue to dominate; check most opted BTech programmes The ceremony was attended by NIT-K alumnus Shri Madhusudhan Ekambaram, CEO and Co-founder of KreditBee, as Chief Guest. Shri Niranjan Mahabalappa, President of the NITK Alumni Association, participated as Guest of Honour. The event was presided over by Prof B Ravi, Director of NIT-K, and saw the presence of faculty, staff, and students, along with institute leadership including Prof Govinda Raj Mandela, Dean of Students Welfare, and Prof Prasanna Belur D, Dean of Alumni and Corporate Relations. title: UP Board Class 10th, 12th Exams: List of centres for annual exams
content: UPMSP Class 10th, 12th Exams 2026: The Uttar Pradesh Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad (UPMSP) has released the list of 7,448 designated exam centres for the UP Board Class 10 and 12 examinations in 2026 . Students who have registered for the UP Board annual examinations for 2026 can raise objections to the exam centre list until December 4. All objections will be reviewed by December 11, after which the final approved list will be published on the official website, upmsp.edu.in. The Uttar Pradesh Board has reduced the number of exam centres from 7,657 to 7,448 compared to last year. In the 2023–24 UP Board examinations, a total of 8,265 centres were allotted. #upboardpryj #BoardExams2026 pic.twitter.com/sgEAlFcfeA — Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad (@upboardpryj) November 30, 2025  The district school inspector will review the objections received, address them promptly, and forward the updated list with the approval and recommendation of the District Centre Determination Committee. The final list will be published online on the board’s official website. Meanwhile, the Uttar Pradesh Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad (UPMSP) had released a revised schedule for the 2026 Class 10 and Class 12 board examinations. The updated timetable includes changes to key subjects, mainly Hindi and Sanskrit, with modifications in both exam dates and timings. Candidates can check the revised schedule on the official X handle of the UP Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad . According to the revised notice, the UP Board Class 10 Hindi and Primary Hindi examinations will now be held on February 18, 2026 , in the morning shift from 8:30 am to 11:45 am. Similarly, the Class 12 Hindi and General Hindi papers are rescheduled for the same day but in the afternoon shift from 2:00 pm to 5:15 pm. The Class 12 Sanskrit paper, originally planned earlier in March, will now be conducted on March 12, 2026, during the same afternoon slot. title: Nagaland Board Class 10th, 12th Exam Dates 2026 Out: Complete timetable for HSLC, HSSCL
content: Nagaland Board Class 10th, 12th Exam Dates 2026: The Nagaland Board of School Education (NBSE) has released the exam schedules for HSLC (Class 10), HSSLC (Class 12) and the Class 11 Promotion Examination for 2026 on its official website at nbsenl.edu.in . As per the notification, Nagaland Board Class 12 board exams will begin on February 12, 2026, while the Nagaland Board Class 10 exams will start on February 13, 2026. Students can check the subject-wise timetable for all three classes below. All NBSE board exams for HSLC and HSSLC will be conducted in the 9 am to 12 noon slot, while the Class 11 Promotion Examination will be held from 1 pm to 4 pm, except for vocational papers which follow shorter durations. Students are advised to reach their centres at least 30 minutes early and carry their admit cards and necessary materials. title: IIT-Kharagpur 2023 vs 2024 BTech placement trends, outlook for 2025: Top companies, sectors and more
content: IIT Kharagpur’s placement cycle for the years 2023, 2024, and the ongoing 2025 drive comes at a time when the institute’s leadership is publicly pushing for a shift in how students view their future careers. Speaking to The Indian Express recently, Director Prof Suman Chakraborty underlined that IIT graduates must “transform their viewpoint from being job seekers to being job creators” , stressing that the institute wants its students to look beyond conventional recruitment cycles and align themselves with broader innovation-led opportunities. Against this backdrop, IIT Kharagpur’s placement trends for 2023 and 2024 and the eventual outlook for 2025 reflect strong recruiter turnout, rising offer volumes, and continued interest from global technology, analytics, semiconductor, finance, and product companies. According to official data cited by media reports, IIT Kharagpur has seen steady growth in total offers over these three years, with major multinational firms, high-paying tech employers, and core engineering companies maintaining a significant presence in the recruitment process. The ongoing 2025 Phase 1 placement, as per reports, also indicates sustained demand for BTech graduates across specialisations. The 2025 placement drive, which began on December 1, 2024, has already crossed 1,800 offers, according to official data reported in the media. This indicates a healthy start compared to previous cycles. The highest package during this phase has touched Rs 2.14 crore per annum, offered by a global technology firm, continuing the institute’s trend of receiving crore-plus offers almost every year. Across undergraduate programmes, around 1,085 students have already been placed in the initial weeks of the drive. While the final average and sector-wise breakdown for BTech is yet to be released, the BTech median salary is expected to align closely with the previous year’s Rs 19.76 lakh, based on the institute’s NIRF disclosures. title: December School Holidays 2025: Full list of state-wise holidays when schools and colleges remain closed
content: School Holidays List in December 2025: The month of December marks a transition point in India’s seasonal and academic calendar. While the peak of the major pan-Indian festive season has typically passed, the month features significant regional events and celebrations across the country, including the Hornbill Festival in Nagaland, the Feast of St. Francis Xavier in Goa, the Rann Utsav in Gujarat, as well as Christmas and New Year festivities. Academically, December is an important time, often marking the season for term-end examinations in schools, and for senior classes, the beginning of pre-board exam season. With the winter season now setting in across many parts of the country, here is an overview of when schools, colleges, and other educational institutes typically observe their scheduled winter breaks and closures in the month of December. In Uttar Pradesh, schools are scheduled to remain shut from December 20 to December 31, forming the main winter break for students. This period typically provides around 10–12 days of vacation, covering both Christmas and New Year’s Eve. Similarly, in states such as Madhya Pradesh, many government, private, and centrally affiliated schools begin their winter or Christmas break from December 23 or 24, extending until December 31 or, in some cases, the first week of January. Christmas Eve on December 24 is not a universal holiday but is often observed in regions with Christian-majority populations or in schools that follow specific cultural calendars. This softer closure then leads into December 25, Christmas Day, which is a national holiday across all educational institutions in the country. Nagaland hosts the Hornbill Festival in the first week of December, drawing significant participation from schools through cultural showcases and educational visits. Goa marks the Feast of St. Francis Xavier in early December, a major religious observance that can lead to localised school holidays. In Gujarat, the Rann Utsav continues th

title: Maharashtra Police Recruitment: Applications to end today for 15,631 posts, apply at policerecruitment2025.mahait.org
content: Maharashtra Police Recruitment 2025: Maharashtra Police has rolled out a massive recruitment campaign under its 2025 recruitment drive, offering 15,631 vacancies across various posts. The drive opens doors for aspirants seeking a government career in law enforcement. Applicants can register and submit their forms through the official portals: mahapolice.gov.in and policerecruitment2025.mahait.org. Positions available include Police Constable, Police Constable Driver, Jail Constable, Police Constable (SRPF), and Police Constable Bandsman. Applications can be submitted online until 30 November 2025. The application started on October 29, with the last date to submit the online fee being December 3. –Age Limit: 18 to 28 years –Educational Qualification: Must have passed Class 12 from a recognised board –Nationality: Indian –Other Requirements: Candidates must meet the physical fitness standards laid down by the Maharashtra Police. Candidates are required to meet the prescribed eligibility criteria before completing the form. The recruitment process will comprise a Physical Efficiency/Standards Test (PET/PST), followed by a written examination, and for certain roles, a skill or driver test. –General/UR candidates: Rs 450 –Reserved categories: Rs 350 Step 1: Visit the official website and click on the online application policerecruitment2025.mahait.org Step 2: Register using a valid email ID and mobile number. Step 3: Log in with the generated registration ID and password to access the form. Step 4: Fill in personal, educational, and contact details carefully. Step 5: Upload a recent photograph, signature, and other required documents in the prescribed format. Step 6: Pay the application fee online and submit the form. Step 7:Take a printout of the submitted application for future reference. content: CAT 2025 Exam Paper Analysis: The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Kozhikode has wrapped up the Common Admission Test 2025. The test was held in three slots. Slot one commenced at 8:30 am and concluded at 10:30 am. Subsequently, slot two began at 12:30 pm and went on till 2:30 pm; slot three began at 3:30 pm and concluded at 5:30 pm. The overall attendance was approximately 86 per cent. CAT 2025 Live Updates : Slot 1 vs. slot 2, which was more difficult? Initial student reactions from test centres suggest that the CAT 2025 Slot 1 paper that was “manageable but slightly more difficult” than last year’s Slot 1. This year’s test comprises 66 questions across Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension (VARC), Data Interpretation & Logical Reasoning (DILR), and Quantitative Ability (QA). As per the marking scheme, candidates will receive three marks for each correct answer, lose one mark for every incorrect answer, and face no penalty for questions not-attempted. According to Gautam Puri, Co-founder and MD of Career Launcher, CAT 2025 Slot 1 had a total of 68 questions to be attempted in 120 minutes, with the overall paper described as “quite tricky” and more difficult than last year. While VARC and QA were broadly at par with last year’s CAT, DILR saw a slight jump in difficulty. A comparative snapshot of the exam pattern was also shared by Ramnath Kanakadandi, Senior Course Director at T.I.M.E., who noted that there were no major pattern or question-type surprises this year, and the total number of questions remained the same as last year’s CAT. title: Meghalaya CM releases Rs 130-crore scholarship for 70,000 students
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K. Sangma announced the release of the second and final instalment of the Umbrella Post Matric Scholarship , amounting to ₹130 crore, for nearly 70,000 students for the 2024-25 academic year on Friday. The event took place at the district auditorium and was attended by Education Minister Lakhmen Rymbui, Commissioner and Secretary of Education Vijay Kumar Mantri, West Garo Hills Deputy Commissioner Vibhor Aggarwal, and Director of Higher and Technical Education Hazel D. B. Sangma. During his address, Sangma explained that the state government is releasing the full scholarship amount using its own resources, as it has not yet received funds from the central government. He emphasised that the decision to provide the funds in advance was made to alleviate difficulties faced by students. Previously, rules prevented the advance transfer of scholarships; however, the state has now established a mechanism with the central government to facilitate earlier disbursement. Once the Rs 130 crore is transferred to the Meghalaya Rural Bank, processing and account verification will take a few days before students receive their funds. He urged students to ensure their bank accounts are linked to Aadhaar. Sangma reiterated that education remains a top priority for the government. He announced that reforms to address long-standing issues faced by ad hoc and SSA teachers are nearing completion and could be implemented in the next financial year. The program also included participation from thousands of students virtually joining from 200 locations across the state. Sangma took this opportunity to outline the government’s long-term vision, which features youth-focused initiatives such as CM Elevate, YESS Meghalaya, PRIME, MGMP, STAR, and Hello Meghalaya. “Entrepreneurship and skilling of the youth is critical for the state’s growth story,” he said. He said the government had planned economic growth not just for the coming years but till 2047, with policies

title: Assam Assembly passes 6 education bills amid opposition walkout
content: The Assam Assembly on Saturday approved six education-related bills, even as opposition members staged a walkout. They alleged that ruling party legislators entered the House after the Speaker ordered the doors closed during voting on their proposed amendments. With no opposition present, the Assembly cleared four key bills: the Assam Non-governmental Educational Institutions (Regulation of Fees) (Amendment) Bill, 2025; the Assam Education (Provincialisation of Teachers and Re-organisation of Educational Institutions) (Amendment) Bill, 2025; the Assam Elementary and Secondary School Teachers (Regulation of Posting and Transfer) (Amendment) Bill, 2025; and the Assam Education (Provincialisation of Services of Non-teaching Staff of Venture Educational Institutions) (Amendment) Bill, 2025. In addition, two other bills—the Azim Premji University Bill, 2025, and the North Eastern Regional Institute of Management (NERIM) University Bill, 2025—both introduced by Education Minister Ranoj Pegu, were passed by voice vote on the final day of the Winter Session. After more than four hours of debate on the four bills introduced by Education Minister Ranoj Pegu, members of the Congress, CPI(M), and Independent MLA Akhil Gogoi expressed discontent that none of their proposed amendments had been accepted by the government. Leader of Opposition Debabrata Saikia of the Congress pressed for a vote on the amendments, a demand supported by CPI(M) legislator Manoranjan Talukdar and the Independent member. As Speaker Biswajit Daimary moved forward with the process of passing the bills, Saikia declared that the opposition would not withdraw its amendments. In response, Daimary ordered all doors of the House to be shut immediately, preventing any MLA from entering or leaving during the proceedings. However, the opposition benches alleged that about 10 ruling BJP legislators entered the House even after the Speaker’s order. The treasury benches, however, refuted the charge. As the Speaker ma

title: Life in an IIT | From watching roads crumble to researching how to rebuild them
content: — Aijaz Maqbool Thoker Growing up in Arampora Ichigam, a small village in the Budgam district of Jammu and Kashmir, about 20 km from Srinagar, my world was simple but full of curiosity. My early schooling happened in my hometown, where I developed a strong inclination toward science and problem-solving. My mother is a homemaker, my father runs a small business, and one of the most influential people in my life has been my uncle, a teacher who shaped my academic habits and discipline from a young age. From childhood, I was driven by one constant observation – the deplorable condition of road infrastructure in my region. I often wondered why the roads were so bad and how things could be improved. This curiosity gradually turned into a focused interest in civil engineering. Today, I am 24 years old and currently undertaking my PhD with the IIT Madras-Deakin Research Academy. I am in the Civil Engineering department at IIT Madras , in my second year of the Joint PhD programme, working on the topic – ‘An effective framework for the extraction and utilisation of recycled materials in road infrastructure’. I will soon be heading to Deakin University, Australia. After finishing my basic schooling in my village, I pursued a BTech in Civil Engineering at NIT Srinagar . I stayed active in projects, technical events and independent learning during my BTech years, but the real shift in my academic direction came when I joined IIT Madras for a research internship. That experience deepened my interest in research. I later returned to IIT Madras for my BTech project, which helped me clearly understand my strengths and long-term goals. The real push towards research came during my internship at IIT Madras under the guidance of Dr Bibhuti Bhushan Bhardwaj (then PhD scholar, now assistant professor) and my mentor Prof Surender Singh. Their support made me see research as a meaningful path to solving real problems. I applied to other IITs and received offers as well, but once I discove

title: CAT 2025 Exam Analysis Highlights: IIM Kozhikode concludes exam; check slot-wise difficulty levels
content: CAT 2025 Exam Live Highlights: The Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode ( IIM Kozhikode ) conducted the Common Admission Test (CAT 2025) on Sunday, November 30, 2025. The test was held in three slots. Slot one commenced at 8:30 am and concluded at 10:30 am. title: Bihar Board Class 10th, 12th Exam Datesheet 2026: BSEB to conduct Inter, Matric exams in February
content: The Bihar School Examination Board ( BSEB ) on Saturday released the detailed annual exam calendar for 2026, covering schedules for the Intermediate (Class 12), Matric (Class 10), DElEd, Vocational courses and various departmental examinations. The calendar also specifies exam dates, application periods, dummy card and admit card release timelines, as well as result declaration windows. According to the BSEB Class 10 datesheet , the Madhyamik (Matric) Annual Examination 2026, which will begin on February 17 and continue till February 25. The calendar also lists vocational and skill-based subjects for Class 10 students. The first shift will be held from 9:30 am to 12:45 pm (with 15 15-minute cool-off time), while the second shift will run from 2 pm to 5:15 pm. T he Class 10 practical and internal assessments will be conducted in January 2026, ahead of the theory papers. The Intermediate Annual Examination 2026 will be conducted from February 2 to February 13, 2026, in two shifts. The practical examinations for BSEB Class 12 students will also be conducted in January 2026. The detailed subject-wise timetable for both streams — Science, Commerce, and Arts — will be uploaded on the official website of the Bihar Board . Students are advised to download the official datesheet once it is made available on the board’s website. The timetable will include subject codes, examination timings, and other important instructions. Schools are expected to share the final timetable and guidelines with students as soon as they receive official communication from the board. Candidates are also advised to keep checking the Bihar Board’s official website regularly for updates or any possible changes in the exam schedule.   The BSEB Class 12 exams last year were held from February 1 to February 15 at 1,677 centres across Bihar. title: Cyclone Ditwah: Schools in Puducherry closed, Pondicherry Central University postpones exams
content: Puducherry Home and Education Minister A Namassivayam announced a holiday for all schools and colleges, including private institutions, in the four regions of Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe, and Yanam on Saturday. The decision was taken in view of the heavy rainfall expected under cyclone Ditwah’s influence. The name ‘Ditwah’, meaning a lagoon, was suggested by Yemen and is likely derived from Detwah Lagoon on the northwest coast of Socotra. Meanwhile, the Pondicherry Central University has announced that all exams scheduled to be held on Saturday have been postponed and a holiday has been declared for all classes at the university because of Cyclone Ditwah which is heading towards the union territory coast. A release from the Registrar of the University on Friday night said that the postponement of examinations and also cancellation of classes were due to a communication received from the Coast Guard about the cyclone and the heavy rains. A revised date of the examinations would be announced in course of time, the release said. Puducherry Lt Governor K Kailashnathan on Friday held an emergency meeting with officials, directing them to take all precautionary measures ahead of heavy rains in the union territory under the influence of cyclone Ditwah. A release from Raj Nivas said the IMD has issued a ‘red alert’ for Puducherry, forecasting intense rainfall on November 29 and 30 due to the cyclone in the Bay of Bengal. A ‘red alert’ indicates heavy-to-extremely heavy rain of over 20 cm in 24 hours. The cyclone is located about 300 km south-southeast of Karaikal, 410 km south-southeast of Puducherry and 510 km south-southeast of Chennai , the bulletin from the India Meteorological Department said. Kailashnathan reviewed the measures already taken by departments, including Revenue and Disaster Management, to tackle the expected impact. He instructed officials from disaster management-related departments to implement preventive measures. Officials informed him that personnel

title: New strategic tie-up to improve outcomes for Indian students in UK
content: A new strategic partnership between one of the UK’s largest student organisations and an international education sector agency announced in London on Friday is expected to lead to improved outcomes for Indian students as a result of fairer recruitment practices. The National Indian Students and Alumni Union (NISAU) UK said its tie-up with International Consultants for Education and Fairs (ICEF) will strengthen transparency, raise standards and ensure accurate and responsible guidance from first point of enquiry through to graduation and enhance the overall international student experience overseas. More than a million Indian students typically choose to study abroad , with the majority relying on education agents for advice. “International students deserve clarity, transparency, and support they can trust,” said ICEF CEO Markus Badde. “By joining forces with NISAU, we are combining ICEF’s global experience with a strong student voice to raise standards across borders,” he said. Read More | 80% leave UK amid tightening immigration rules, Indian students form biggest group: Govt data The partnership will initially focus on three key areas: promotion of ethical and transparent recruitment practices in the India-UK space; development of shared standards and guidance to support students and institutions; and production of joint insights that inform policy and sector best practice. “ICEF’s long-standing commitment to quality will help ensure that students receive the right support at the right time. This partnership puts students at the centre of recruitment practice,” said Sanam Arora, NISAU UK Founder and Chair. The need for trusted information, clear quality benchmarks and genuine protection for international students is seen as crucial at a time when policy frameworks are constantly shifting across major higher education destinations, such as the UK. Both organisations hope their new collaboration will prove an important step toward a more transparent and student-focu

title: How to attempt JEE Main 2026 mock test?
content: – Dr Saurabh Kumar As the date for the JEE Main 2026 approaches fast, many aspirants find themselves in a particularly intense phase of preparation. This is the time when most students are juggling multiple demands—revision, full-length syllabus coverage, coaching classes, test series, and the pressure to meet their own expectations. As the exam inches closer, it is natural to experience stress and a sense of urgency to perform well. Amidst all this, aspirants often look for methods that can make their preparation more effective, structured, and result-oriented. Among all the activities that make up the preparation cycle – from reading coaching notes, watching lectures, solving modules, and developing personalised study strategies – one of the most powerful tools available to every student is the Mock Test. But simply taking a mock test is not enough. The real value lies in taking each mock seriously, approaching it with exam-like discipline, analysing the results with patience and depth, and learning something meaningful from every attempt. Read More | How to balance JEE Main 2026 & Class 12th board exam preparation When mock tests are used thoughtfully and consistently, they help in developing a mental discipline, sharpening cognitive ability, improving precision, and building the confidence needed to face the actual JEE Main exam . They also play a major role in helping students understand their strengths and weaknesses while improving their test-taking skills. Before taking mock tests regularly, the first and most important step is to ensure that you choose the right mock tests. Not all mock tests available online or offline are equally useful, and selecting the wrong ones can result in either overconfidence or unnecessary fear. To identify which mock series is right for you, you must check whether the test pattern aligns with the latest JEE Main structure – the difficulty level, types of questions asked, marking scheme, and balance of topics. Some of the most r

title: ISB Summer Internship Report 2025: Highest stipend of Rs 7.3 lakh, top companies include Accenture, McKinsey, HUL
content: The Indian School of Business ( ISB ) has released the summer internship reports for the inaugural 2025–27 cohort of its Post Graduate Programme in Management for Young Leaders (PGP YL). The cohort has an average work experience of 11 months. According to the official statement, students received more than 175 internship offers from 38 companies across multiple sectors. The average stipend stood at Rs 3.2 lakh, while the highest stipend offered was Rs 7.3 lakh. Consulting firms accounted for the largest share of internship opportunities, contributing 47% of total offers. Accenture made 37 offers, making it the top recruiter. McKinsey & Company, Bain & Company, and Boston Consulting Group together extended 19 offers. EY-Parthenon, PwC, and Deloitte USI also participated, offering roles in areas such as strategy, analytics, and business transformation. Assignments in finance, investment advisory, and private equity made up 19% of the internship pool. Organisations participating included Jefferies, Mastercard, Barclays, Sorin Investments, DSP Asset Managers, JM Financial, Motilal Oswal, and Axis Bank. FMCG companies constituted 11% of total offers. HUL, ITC, Colgate-Palmolive, Dabur, and Castrol hired for roles primarily in brand management and marketing strategy, according to the school. Also Read| IIM-Ahmedabad Summer Placements 2026 Technology firms accounted for 10% of internships. Companies such as Amazon, Media.net, Practo, and Ola offered product management roles. Conglomerates made up 7% of the internships, with participation from the Aditya Birla Group, Hinduja Group, Adani Enterprises , and Jindal. These firms offered roles in business operations, transformation, and strategy. Also Read| IIM-Calcutta achieves 100% summer internship placements, highest stipend at Rs 6 lakh The remaining 6% of offers came from organisations including Hero MotoCorp, Country Delight, the William J Clinton Foundation, and Oyo Rooms. title: 80% leave UK amid tightening immigration rules, Indian students form biggest group: Govt data
content: Indian students and workers accounted for the largest share of visa-holders leaving the United Kingdom this year, according to the latest figures released by the Office for National Statistics (ONS). The UK’s net migration for the year ending June 2025 fell by 204,000, marking an 80 per cent drop from its 2023 peak, one of the steepest annual declines since post-pandemic reopening. The ONS data, according to a PTI report, shows that around 45,000 Indians on study visas and 22,000 on work visas left the country during this period. A further 7,000 Indian nationals recorded under the ‘other’ visa category also emigrated, taking the total to approximately 74,000 Indian departures, the highest among non-EU nationalities. Chinese nationals recorded the second-highest exits at around 42,000. The ONS, in its release, noted that Indian citizens formed the single largest non-EU group leaving the UK, even as they continued to remain the top nationality arriving for both study and work. Despite the outflow, Indians still received 90,000 study visa grants and 46,000 work visas in the same period, underscoring their continued significance in UK immigration trends. The ONS attributes this high level of emigration primarily to international students who originally entered the UK on study visas. The data states that the increase in long-term emigration of non-EU nationals who originally arrived on study-related visas is primarily being driven by the large numbers of Indian and Chinese nationals leaving in the year ending June 2025. The fall in net migration coincides with a series of tightening measures introduced by the UK government, particularly affecting international students and entry-level workers. Business groups in London, however, have expressed concern that these sharper controls are coming at a cost. A recent report by The Indian Express shows that 93 per cent of London businesses say international talent helps address skills shortages, and 84 per cent believe internatio

title: Jharkhand JAC Class 10th, 12th timetables released for 2026 board exams
content: JAC Jharkhand Class 10, 12 date sheet 2026: The Jharkhand Academic Council (JAC) has released the date sheet for the 2026 board examination. The JAC Class 10 Matric and Class 12 Intermediate exams will begin on February 3. The Class 10 JAC 2026 exams will continue till February 17, Class 12 Inter exams will continue till February 23, 2026. The JAC Class 10 secondary exams will be held from 9.45 am to 1 pm and the Class 12 inter exams will be conducted between 2 pm and 5.15 pm. In the examination of non-linguistic subjects of the JAC Class 12 intermediate level, only answer sheets written in Devanagari, Roman, Bangla, Urdu or Oriya script will be valid. In the HNB MB subject examination to be held in the second shift on February 23, two separate plain answer sheets will be used by the students. It will be mandatory to record the serial number of both the answer sheets in the attendance sheet also. Only one answer sheet will be used for the biology subject. A 15-minute extra time will be given to review the question papers of JAC Class 10 secondary and JAC Class 12 intermediate examination. In 2025, over 4.33 lakh students appeared for the Jharkhand Class 10 board exams . The written examinations were conducted from February 11 to March 3, followed by practical exams held between March 4 and March 20. The Jharkhand board held the Class 12 board 2025 exams between February 11 and March 4, and practical exams were conducted from March 5 to March 20. title: PSEB announces entrepreneurship curriculum for Class 12th, aims to encourage self-employment and innovation to over 5.6 lakh students
content: In an initiative aimed at inspiring young minds towards innovation and self-employment, the Punjab School Education Board ( PSEB ) has finalised the entrepreneurship curriculum for Class 12. The PSEB has finalised the curriculum for Class 12, completing a two-year educational pathway designed to foster innovation, self-reliance and job creation among students, Education Minister Harjot Singh Bains said on Thursday. Building on the success of the ‘Business Blaster programme’ launched for Class 11 in 2022-23, Bains lauded the PSEB’s efforts. He stated that the PSEB has demonstrated exceptional commitment by introducing entrepreneurship as a compulsory subject across 3,692 senior secondary schools and equipping 10,382 teachers and 231 master trainers through 104 training programmes. With the Class 12 curriculum and textbooks ready ahead of schedule, around 5.60 lakh students will pursue entrepreneurship without interruption in the 2026-27 academic year, an official statement said. Bains said that the comprehensive curriculum would equip the students to transform ideas into viable ventures, covering startup challenges, legal procedures, finance, budgeting and more, preparing Punjab’s youth to be job providers and economic drivers of tomorrow. This initiative fulfils a key promise of Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann -led Punjab government to equip students in government and recognised schools with the mindset and practical skills for self-employment, startups and entrepreneurship, thereby fueling the state’s economic development, he added. title: TN TRB Result 2025 declared for PG parts A, B at trb.tn.gov.in
content: The Tamil Nadu Teachers Recruitment Board has declared the TN TRB Result 2025 on 27 November 2025 for the recruitment of Post Graduate Assistants and Physical Director Grade 1 posts. The board has released the qualifying status, individual marks, and the subject-wise list of candidates shortlisted for the certificate verification process. Candidates can check their qualifying status on the official website at trb.tn.gov.in . The OMR-based examination comprised Part A (Tamil Eligibility Test) and Part B (Main Subject). Candidates who took the test can now view their results on the official website, trb.tn.gov.in. The results have been published in PDF format and include details such as the candidate’s name, roll number, date of birth, marks obtained, and eligibility status. As per the board’s criteria, candidates had to score at least 40% in Part A, which is 20 marks out of 50. Only those who achieved this qualifying score had their Part B responses evaluated. The TN TRB 2025 results have been released separately for subjects including Tamil, English, Commerce, Economics, Mathematics, History, Geography, Physics, Chemistry, Political Science, Botany, Zoology, Computer Science, and Physical Education. Candidates who clear the written examination will be invited for certificate verification against the 1996 available vacancies. Step 4: Select the result link — “Direct Recruitment for PG Assistant…Instructor Grade 1 (02/2025) – Release of Part A and B Result.” Step 5: Upon clicking, result PDF will open. Use CTRL+F to search for your name or roll number. If qualified in both sections, download and save the PDF for reference.
